basics.name: David Ricardo Figueroa Blanco
basics.label: Computational Scientist & Data Specialist
basics.summary: Ph.D. in Data Science and Computation with a strong foundation in physical chemistry and machine learning. Expert in bridging the gap between theoretical molecular modeling and modern data engineering. Specialized in AI for Drug Discovery, High-Performance Simulation, and Full-Stack Prototyping.

work.name: Italian Institute of Technology (IIT)
work.position: PhD Researcher - AI for Structural Drug Design
work.summary: Designed 3D Convolutional Neural Networks for fragment-based drug design. Built end-to-end data pipeline to process ~215,000 PDB entries. Developed PyMOL Plugin for real-time model inference visualization.

work.name: DeepChem (Open Source Library)
work.summary: Mentored student project enhancing DeepChem's capabilities. Conducted weekly code reviews and guided Pull Request lifecycle. Authored tutorial on modeling Proteolysis Targeting Chimeras (PROTACs).

work.name: Universidad de los Andes
work.summary: Supervised groups of 25–30 undergraduate students in General Chemistry and Fundamentals of Chemical Analysis laboratories. Delivered pre-lab lectures and guided wet-lab experimental procedures.

projects.name: AI for Structural Drug Design
projects.summary: Developed 3D Convolutional Neural Networks using PyTorch for fragment-based drug design, achieving 70% top-1 accuracy on protein-ligand binding prediction.

projects.name: Biophysical Modeling of DNA Polymerases
projects.summary: Conducted over 6 microseconds of Molecular Dynamics simulations and Alchemical Free Energy Perturbation calculations to understand polymerase fidelity.
